item.title: 特朗普的关税确实会咬人——当他真的实施时
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普征收的关税比至少一个世纪以来的任何美国总统都多——但仅占他威胁征收关税的一小部分。【原文：Donald Trump has imposed more tariffs than any American president in at least a century – but only a fraction of the ones he’s threatened.】

item.title: 苹果称欧盟正利用"政治拖延战术"对应用变更施加罚款
item.description: 苹果公司指责欧盟委员会利用"政治拖延战术"推迟实施新的应用程序政策，以此为借口对这家iPhone制造商展开调查并处以罚款。【原文：Apple Inc. accused the European Commission of using “political delay tactics” to postpone new app policies as a pretense to investigate and fine the iPhone maker.】

item.title: 亚洲股市料将上涨，美国数据及日本央行成焦点：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市周五有望跟随华尔街走高，因乐观的美国经济数据、科技股的强劲上涨以及地缘政治紧张局势的缓解提振了投资者情绪。【原文：Asian equities looked set to follow Wall Street higher Friday, as upbeat US economic data, a surge in tech stocks, and easing geopolitical tensions buoyed investor sentiment.】

item.title: 亚马逊准备裁撤数千名企业员工
item.description: 亚马逊公司正准备裁减数千名企业员工，以加大精简官僚机构的力度。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is gearing up to ax thousands more corporate employees, ratcheting up efforts to streamline bureaucracy.】

item.title: 新西兰通胀率突破央行1-3%目标区间
item.description: 新西兰通胀率在第四季度突破储备银行设定的1%-3%目标区间，经济复苏持续推高物价，这增加了今年晚些时候加息的可能性。【原文：New Zealand inflation pushed above the Reserve Bank’s 1-3% target band in the fourth quarter as an economic recovery keeps pressure on prices, raising the risk of higher interest rates later this year.】

item.title: 乌克兰在调整增长挂钩债务后获标普评级上调
item.description: 在乌克兰完成将增长挂钩债务重组为常规债券后，标准普尔全球评级公司上调了该国的信用评级。【原文：Ukraine’s credit score was raised by S&P Global Ratings after the country completed the restructuring of its growth-linked debt into conventional bonds.】

item.title: 一位备受争议的电子游戏设计师携新作回归，引发新一轮争议
item.description: 《沉没之星勋章》的发布因其创作者乔纳森·布洛的政治观点而遭到批评。【原文：The announcement of ‘Order of the Sinking Star’ was met with criticism over the political views of its creator Jonathan Blow】

item.title: 高乐氏以22.5亿美元收购洗手液制造商GOJO
item.description: 高乐氏公司已同意收购Purell免洗洗手液制造商GOJO Industries，此举旨在扩大其消费健康与卫生品牌组合。【原文：Clorox Co. agreed to buy the maker of Purell hand sanitizer, GOJO Industries, a move to expand its portfolio of consumer health and hygiene brands.】

item.title: 英特尔因供应短缺影响销售业绩，发布疲软预测
item.description: 英特尔公司对当前季度给出了令人失望的预测，原因是供应短缺使其更难满足客户需求，这令期待新产品带来更大提振的投资者感到失望。【原文：Intel Corp. gave a lackluster forecast for the current quarter because supply shortages are making it harder to meet customer demand, a disappointment for investors who anticipated more of a boost from new products.】

item.title: 达沃斯与会者聚焦人工智能回报，此前一年该领域投资力度空前
item.description: 若说去年达沃斯世界经济论坛的核心议题是需要大规模公私投资来支持人工智能发展，那么今年的论坛则更侧重于证明其回报价值。【原文：If a key focus at last year’s World Economic Forum in Davos was the need for massive private and public investments to support artificial intelligence development, this year’s event was more about proving the payoff.】

item.title: 韩国消费者信心在GDP下滑后回升
item.description: 韩国消费者信心指数攀升至去年11月以来最高水平，表明即便在去年第四季度经济陷入萎缩之后，家庭情绪依然保持乐观。【原文：South Korea’s consumer confidence climbed to its highest since November, suggesting household sentiment remains upbeat even after the economy slipped into contraction during the final quarter of last year.】

item.title: 橡树资本、安克雷奇加入First Brands债务融资协议贷款，公司面临现金消耗压力
item.description: 困境债务巨头橡树资本管理公司和安克雷奇资本已在第一品牌集团的破产融资中积累了大量头寸，此时正值这家汽车零部件供应商的新一轮注资谈判进入最后关头。【原文：Distressed-debt giants Oaktree Capital Management and Anchorage Capital have amassed positions in the bankruptcy financing for First Brands Group, stepping in as negotiations over a fresh capital injection for the auto parts supplier come down to the wire.】

item.title: 法拉奇在达沃斯会见贝森特，同时完善英国经济计划
item.description: 奈杰尔·法拉奇在达沃斯与美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特会面，这位英国改革党领袖正试图证明自己具备在国际舞台上立足的实力。【原文：Nigel Farage met with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent in Davos, as the Reform UK leader attempts to prove he has what it takes to stand on the global stage.】

item.title: 与俄罗斯有关联的稳定币交易量一年内突破1000亿美元
item.description: 为规避对俄罗斯制裁而创建的卢布挂钩稳定币，自推出以来不到一年时间内交易额已突破1000亿美元——尽管该代币本身仍面临持续限制。【原文：The ruble-backed stablecoin created to circumvent sanctions on Russia has surpassed $100 billion in transactions in less than a year since its launch — even as the token itself faces ongoing restrictions.】

item.title: 男装仓库公司增发11亿美元债券以提升分红
item.description: 男士服装仓库的母公司Tailored Brands Inc.将贷款和债券发行规模合计增加2亿美元，用于向股东支付更高额的股息。【原文：Tailored Brands Inc., the parent company of Men’s Wearhouse, boosted its loan and bond offerings by a combined $200 million to fund an even larger dividend payout to its owners.】

item.title: 斯塔默严阵以待，力阻伯纳姆进入下议院
item.description: 基尔·斯塔默正准备与一位关键左翼对手展开可能的对决，这场较量将考验英国首相抵御日益加剧的职位威胁的能力。【原文：Keir Starmer is bracing for a potential showdown with a key left-wing rival in a test of the British prime minister’s power to stave off the gathering threats to his job.】

item.title: 英国播客创作者正移师美国，以在关键市场赢得听众
item.description: 英国最受欢迎的播客节目大多尚未在美国达到同等热度。【原文：Most of the top podcasts in the UK have yet to hit the same levels of popularity in the US】

item.title: 从TACO到Widowmaker：驱动市场的交易指南
item.description: 本周，金融市场因特朗普总统非正统的地缘政治策略以及日本的传统竞选活动而被推向高潮。【原文：Financial markets were kicked into high-gear this week by President Donald Trump’s unorthodox approach to geopolitics and old-school electioneering in Japan.】

item.title: 曾任高盛银行家、在1MDB欺诈案中认罪者寻求赦免
item.description: 曾参与史上最大金融欺诈案之一的投行高管蒂姆·莱斯纳，在向联邦监狱投案前正寻求总统特赦。【原文：Tim Leissner, the former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker who admitted his role in one of the largest financial frauds in history, is seeking a presidential pardon before he surrenders to a federal prison.】

item.title: 特朗普对格陵兰的威胁如何重振了TACO贸易
item.description: 为争夺丹麦半自治领地格陵兰岛的控制权，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普威胁对八个欧洲国家的进口商品加征新关税。这场风波导致股市暴跌，投资者纷纷涌向黄金等避险资产。【原文：In his bid to gain control over Greenland, a semi-autonomous territory of Denmark, US President Donald Trump threatened to impose fresh tariffs on imports from eight European countries. The drama sent stocks sliding as investors flocked to gold and other safe-haven assets.】

item.title: 桑巴诺瓦吸引更多大型投资者，英特尔表现出兴趣，首席执行官表示
item.description: 据该公司首席执行官发给员工的邮件显示，人工智能芯片与基础设施供应商SambaNova Systems Inc.在寻求新一轮融资过程中，除英特尔公司持续关注外，还吸引了"更多大型投资者"的关注。【原文：SambaNova Systems Inc., which sells chips and infrastructure for artificial intelligence tasks, has attracted the attention of “additional large investors” along with continued interest from Intel Corp. in the startup’s pursuit of new funding, according to an email its chief executive officer sent to staff.】

item.title: 松林机会基金为新创投二级基金筹集22亿美元
item.description: 松林机遇合伙公司为其首支基金成功募集22亿美元，在风险投资市场快速增长的细分领域完成了一轮大规模融资。【原文：Pinegrove Opportunity Partners has raised $2.2 billion for its debut fund, closing a large investment round in a fast-growing niche of the venture capital market.】

item.title: 活动人士普兰特罗推动农业增长公司董事会改组
item.description: 一位激进投资者正推动对Ag Growth International董事会进行重组，理由是该公司上周收到监管机构的停牌令且首席执行官离职后，其治理结构已严重失效。【原文：An activist investor is pressing for a board shakeup at Ag Growth International, citing what it calls a severe governance breakdown following a regulatory cease-trade order and the departure of the company’s chief executive officer last week.】

item.title: 苹果扩大硬件主管职责范围，最新迹象显示其有望接任CEO
item.description: 苹果公司已扩大硬件主管约翰·特纳斯的职责范围，使其涵盖设计工作，这进一步巩固了他作为首席执行官蒂姆·库克潜在继任者的领先地位。【原文：Apple Inc. has expanded the job of hardware chief John Ternus to include design work, solidifying his status as a leading contender to eventually succeed Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook.】

item.title: 纽约州削减康埃迪电力公司85%的调价申请，称其价格过高
item.description: 据周四发布的新闻稿称，纽约监管机构批准了联合爱迪生公司与其他各方达成的协议，该协议将在未来三年内限制该公用事业公司的收入，并对客户账单的涨幅设定上限。【原文：New York regulators adopted an agreement between Consolidated Edison Inc. and other parties that would limit the utility’s revenues — and cap increases to customer bills — for the next three years, according to a news release Thursday.】

item.title: 沙特聚焦"更明智"的支出，因油价下跌导致收入受限
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯官员在达沃斯世界经济论坛上强化了政府财政政策转向的表态，称这个王国在经历多年"全速前进"后，正致力于调整战略，如今比以往任何时候都更注重"更明智"的支出。【原文：Saudi Arabian officials sharpened their messaging on the government’s fiscal shift at the World Economic Forum in Davos, saying the kingdom is focused now more than ever before on “wiser” spending as it works to fine tune its strategy after years of going “full throttle.”】

item.title: 据称猛犸公司考虑在今年下半年启动首次公开募股
item.description: 知情人士透露，消费品公司Mammoth Brands（旗下拥有男士剃须刀品牌Harry's）正考虑在今年下半年尽快在美国启动首次公开募股（IPO）。【原文：Consumer goods company Mammoth Brands, the owner of men’s razor brand Harry’s, is considering holding its US initial public offering as soon as the second half of this year, people with knowledge of the matter said.】
